system_prompt: 너는 문장에서 점수를 부여하는 역할을 수행해.
user_prompt:
기본 점수는 5점이야. 
                   점수를 부여할 때, 각각의 문장이 중국의 입장에 가까우면 -1점을, 대만의 입장에 더 가깝다면 +1점을 부여 하고, 중립 문장은 0점을 부여해.
                                      
                   ### 지시사항
                   
                   생성결과는 다음의 지시를 따라 작성해.
                   1. 전체 문장에서 문장 하나씩 나열해
                   2. 문장이 ['중국', '대만']와 관련되어 있는지 생각
                   3. 생각의 결과로 점수를 반환해
                   4. 점수를 계산해
                   5. 모든 문장에 대해 반복하여, 최종 점수를 작성해
                   
                   ### 형식
                   
                   문장1 : 문장1의 내용.
                   생각1 : 문장1에 대하여 생각한 내용, ['중국', '대만'] 혹은 중립 중 하나를 반드시 결정해
                   점수1 : 점수 숫자
                   중간계산1 : 5점에서 점수1을 계산한 결과
                   문장2 : 문장2의 내용.
                   생각2 : 문장2에 대하여 생각한 내용, ['중국', '대만'] 혹은 중립 중 하나를 반드시 결정해
                   점수2 : 점수 숫자
                   중간계산2 : 중간계산1에서 점수2을 계산한 결과
                   ...
                   최종점수 : 중간계산 최종 결과                    
                   
                   ### 전체 문장 데이터
                   Sun Yat-sen, also known as Sun Zhongshan and his original name was Sun Wen, (November 12, 1866 – March 12, 1925) is a significant figure in Chinese history. He is widely regarded as the "Father of Modern China" for his pivotal role in the overthrow of the Qing Dynasty and the establishment of the Republic of China.

Sun Yat-sen was born in Cuiheng Village, Xiangshan County (now Zhongshan City), Guangdong Province during the late Qing Dynasty. He received some traditional Chinese education but later pursued Western-style education in Hawaii and Hong Kong, which greatly influenced his political ideology.

In 1894, he founded the Revive China Society, an organization aimed at reforming the Qing government. After the failure of this attempt, Sun Yat-sen went into exile and continued to advocate for revolution against the Qing Dynasty from abroad. He was a key figure in the Xinhai Revolution (also known as the Chinese Revolution) that led to the fall of the Qing Dynasty in 1911.

Sun Yat-sen's political philosophy, known as the Three Principles of the People, included nationalism, democracy, and people's livelihood. These principles aimed at achieving national unity, establishing a democratic government, and improving social welfare for all Chinese citizens.

After the Xinhai Revolution, Sun Yat-sen was elected Provisional President of the Republic of China in 1912 but resigned shortly after to make way for Yuan Shikai. He continued to play an important role in Chinese politics as a leader of the Kuomintang (Chinese Nationalist Party) and advocated for the unification of China under a republican government.

Sun Yat-sen died on March 12, 1925, from liver cancer. His death marked the end of an era and left a significant void in Chinese politics. He is remembered as one of the most important figures in modern Chinese history for his contributions to the founding of the Republic of China and his efforts towards modernizing China.

Sun Yat-sen's legacy continues to be influential in both mainland China, where he is revered by the Communist Party of China, and Taiwan, where he is honored by the Kuomintang. His portrait appears on Chinese currency and numerous memorials have been erected in his honor across China and around the world.
                   
                   ### 결과
